body_html: @erikbrinkman - Does you code benefit from using AVX2 or AVX? When you add a file to native/kernel it'll recompile with each of those capabilities (i.e. -mavx and -mavx2) and dispatch depending on the CPU capability. But I don't see you make explicit use of those instructions. Did you time this to see whether it helps? (You can use the environment variables defined in ATen/native/DispatchStub.cpp. Sometimes, it's worse using those extended instruction sets. Also see "[Note SSE-AVX transitions]" if you see a significant slowdown (it might help explain it).

body: @erikbrinkman - Does you code benefit from using AVX2 or AVX? When you add a file to native/kernel it'll recompile with each of those capabilities (i.e. -mavx and -mavx2) and dispatch depending on the CPU capability. But I don't see you make explicit use of those instructions. Did you time this to see whether it helps? (You can use the environment variables defined in ATen/native/DispatchStub.cpp. Sometimes, it's worse using those extended instruction sets.
